qa.q: Where do I find tip sheets for ambulatory workflows?
qa.a: Press F1 → Learning Home Dashboard → select role-specific section.

qa.q: How do I set a patient’s preferred lab?
qa.a: During rooming, in the Rooming Navigator, select the Preferred Lab field.

qa.q: Why isn’t my Medicare Wellness form showing?
qa.a: Scroll to bottom of Screenings Navigator; if missing, go to Flowsheets → search 'Medicare Wellness'.
steps: Scroll to bottom of Screenings Navigator; if missing, go to Flowsheets

qa.q: What’s the difference between internal and external referrals?
qa.a: Internal referrals often require prior auth and coordination; external referrals have simpler routing.

qa.q: A provider is missing from referral orders. What should I do?
qa.a: Use the FIND tool to enroll the provider into Epic.

qa.q: How do charges drop for immunizations?
qa.a: Document in Immunization activity → both med and admin charges drop automatically.
steps: both med and admin charges drop automatically.

qa.q: Why didn’t my point-of-care test charge?
qa.a: Ensure status = Final in Enter/Edit Results; otherwise no charge posts.

qa.q: How do I schedule a telemedicine appointment?
qa.a: Use the Telemedicine Visit Type when scheduling; otherwise Video Connect won’t activate.

qa.q: Patient says they didn’t get their MyChart code. What do I do?
qa.a: Regenerate and send via text/email; remind them it’s valid for 14 days.

qa.q: How do I know which pool I belong to?
qa.a: Open In Basket → pool name shows at top (department name); managers assign if unclear.
steps: pool name shows at top (department name); managers assign if unclear.

qa.q: What if refill requests are still routing to old Ascension Epic?
qa.a: Submit a ticket to SureScripts including provider name and MRN.

qa.q: Can I use Epic for PDMP checks?
qa.a: Not yet — log into ILPMP.org until state approves Epic integration.

qa.q: What is the In Basket used for in pharmacy?
qa.a: It’s used for communication between nursing and pharmacy, e.g., med time adjustments, refill requests.

qa.q: What if IV or unit dose cards don’t print automatically?
qa.a: Use the Card Status or manually reprint labels via the dispensing button.

qa.q: How do I reprint cart fill labels?
qa.a: Go to dispensing button → reprint labels manually.

qa.q: What if my label printer isn’t working?
qa.a: Reroute printing to another printer; open an IT ticket if issue persists.

qa.q: How do I validate barcodes for new meds from Cardinal?
qa.a: Use Validate Barcodes workflow; scan med to confirm NDC on central list.

qa.q: What if a medication’s NDC isn’t in the system?
qa.a: Submit scan details (med name, strength, NDC, manufacturer, cost) so pharmacy can update or assign IID.

qa.q: How are mixture records handled?
qa.a: Select via clinical edit details; switch base if needed (NS vs dextrose). Ticket if missing.

qa.q: How do I manage patient’s own meds?
qa.a: Set charge method = no charge, change dispense code to 'patient supply', uncheck patient supply box.

qa.q: Where do I find role-specific tip sheets?
qa.a: Press F1 → Learning Home Dashboard → select pharmacist or technician.

qa.q: What if my ADS tab shows blank IID?
qa.a: Open IT ticket to request IID for missing medication (except mixtures).
